plot: Father Ted hosts the "Lovely Girls Festival 96" , while Dougal gives the house away to a visiting feminist.

Whilst Ted is judging the local Lovely Girls Festival beauty contest Niamh Connolly, a feminist singer and strong critic of the Catholic church, turns up at the house and a confused Dougal signs it over to her. An appalled Ted tries to get in with Niamh by claiming to be a fan but she eventually gives him back his house - at a cost. Rather than dine at a restaurant with the Lovely Girls winner Imelda at her expense as is the norm Ted must do the housework with Dougal whilst Niamh takes Imelda and the over-worked Mrs Doyle out for dinner instead.—don @ minifie-1
